intro: Dasylirion hartwegianum, commonly known as the Hartweg’s sotol, is a perennial shrub native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its rosette of thick, blue-gray, sword-shaped leaves. The plant produces tall, branched inflorescences bearing small, greenish-white flowers in early summer. It is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils and desert scrub habitats. Dasylirion hartwegianum is drought-tolerant and has historical uses by indigenous peoples for food and fiber.
